summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Expedia Group, demanding records related to flights purchased, booked, or taken by Ghislaine Maxwell. It includes a cover letter requesting non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation and a declaration form for a custodian of records.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena and cover letter as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subpoena specifically requests all records from Expedia regarding any flights purchased, booked, or taken by her.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is leading the grand jury investigation for which Maxwell is the subject of the subpoena for travel records.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The subpoena commands Expedia Group to appear before the grand jury on this date, though a personal appearance is waived if records are produced by the return date.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: The grand jury subpoena is issued and dated, formally requesting flight records for Ghislaine Maxwell from Expedia Group.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
keyFacts: A federal grand jury in the Southern District of New York is investigating suspected felonies, including potential violations of 18 U.S.C. ยง 2423(a) (transportation of minors for illegal sexual activity).
The subpoena specifically targets all Expedia records related to flights involving Ghislaine Maxwell.
The U.S. Attorney's Office requested that Expedia voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve investigation confidentiality.
The document indicates an active criminal investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell's travel activities as of January 2020.
